Package alix.lucene.util

Class WordsAutomatonBuilder

java.lang.Object
alix.lucene.util.WordsAutomatonBuilder
public final class WordsAutomatonBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
Because Lucene DaciukMihovAutomatonBuilder is final and can't be extended...

Builds a minimal, deterministic Automaton that accepts a set of strings. The algorithm requires sorted input data, but is very fast (nearly linear with the input size).

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add​(java.lang.String current)

    • add

      public void add​(CharsRef current)
      Add another character sequence to this automaton. The sequence must be lexicographically larger or equal compared to any previous sequences added to this automaton (the input must be sorted).

    • complete

      public alix.lucene.util.WordsAutomatonBuilder.State complete()
      Finalize the automaton and return the root state. No more strings can be added to the builder after this call.
      Returns:
      Root automaton state.

    • build

      public static Automaton build​(java.util.Collection<BytesRef> input)
      Build a minimal, deterministic automaton from a sorted list of BytesRef representing strings in UTF-8. These strings must be binary-sorted.

    • buildFronStrings

      public static Automaton buildFronStrings​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> words)
      Build an automaton from a list of strings, sorted is not required.
      Parameters:
      words -
      Returns:

    • buildFronStrings

      public static Automaton buildFronStrings​(java.lang.String[] words)
      Build an automaton from an array of Strings (will be sorted).
      Parameters:
      words -
      Returns:
